member.name: F:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.s_wrapperMap
member.summary: The wrapper map to use to hold the objects

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.#ctor
member.summary: Private constructor to prevent object creation

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the named logger if it exists

remarks.para: If the named logger exists (in the default hierarchy) then it returns a reference to the logger, otherwise it returns null.

member.param: The fully qualified logger name to look for

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.Exists(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the named logger if it exists

remarks.para: If the named logger exists (in the specified domain) then it returns a reference to the logger, otherwise it returns null.

member.param: the domain to lookup in
The fully qualified logger name to look for

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.Exists(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the named logger if it exists

remarks.para: If the named logger exists (in the specified assembly's domain) then it returns a reference to the logger, otherwise it returns null.

member.param: the assembly to use to lookup the domain
The fully qualified logger name to look for

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.GetCurrentLoggers
member.summary: Returns all the currently defined loggers in the default domain.

remarks.para: The root logger is not included in the returned array.

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.GetCurrentLoggers(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all the currently defined loggers in the specified domain.
member.param: the domain to lookup in
member.remarks: The root logger is not included in the returned array.

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.GetCurrentLoggers(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Returns all the currently defined loggers in the specified assembly's domain.
member.param: the assembly to use to lookup the domain
member.remarks: The root logger is not included in the returned array.

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.GetLogger(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve or create a named logger.

remarks.para: Retrieve a logger named as the parameter. If the named logger already exists, then the existing instance will be returned. Otherwise, a new instance is created.
By default, loggers do not have a set level but inherit it from the hierarchy. This is one of the central features of log4net.

member.param: The name of the logger to retrieve.
member.returns: the logger with the name specified

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.GetLogger(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve or create a named logger.

remarks.para: Retrieve a logger named as the parameter. If the named logger already exists, then the existing instance will be returned. Otherwise, a new instance is created.
By default, loggers do not have a set level but inherit it from the hierarchy. This is one of the central features of log4net.

member.param: the domain to lookup in
The name of the logger to retrieve.
member.returns: the logger with the name specified

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.GetLogger(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve or create a named logger.

remarks.para: Retrieve a logger named as the parameter. If the named logger already exists, then the existing instance will be returned. Otherwise, a new instance is created.
By default, loggers do not have a set level but inherit it from the hierarchy. This is one of the central features of log4net.

member.param: the assembly to use to lookup the domain
The name of the logger to retrieve.
member.returns: the logger with the name specified

member.name: M:log4net.Ext.EventID.EventIDLogManager.GetLogger(System.Type)
member.remarks: Get the logger for the fully qualified name of the type specified.
member.param: The full name of will be used as the name of the logger to retrieve.
member.returns: the logger with the name specified
